code.comment: " * This is the source code group."
" * \brief The soruce code that runs the chess program."
" * Comments: This code uses Doxygen styled comments."
" * Copyright Â©2011-2012 Benjamin Kellogg all rights are reserved."
"!< Defines debugging for the main function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the playGame function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the menu function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the startup function. "
"! Menu for selecting the player colors"
"! Allows for new random numbers to be generated each run"
"! Gives the user an introduction to the program"
"! Creates a game based off of the user's choices"
" Stores how many pieces of a certain piece type a player starts with, elements in the array are indexed by the int value of the PieceType enum"
" * This is the game play group."
" * \brief The code that makes up the chess game."
" * Comments: This code uses Doxygen styled comments."
" * Copyright Â©2011-2012 Benjamin Kellogg all rights are reserved."
"!< Defines debugging for the Game class. "
"!< Defines debugging for the Game constructor. "
"!< Defines debugging for the Game destructor. "
"!< Defines debugging for the validMove function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the move function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the clear function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the over function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the str function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the operator= function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the simulateMove function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the tokenizeMove function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the initPieces function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the PieceCount function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the clearPieceCount function. "
"!< Defines debugging for the inLabels function. "
" * from the piece, you will need"
" * to query the board to know if"
" * to have sets of Move objects instead"
" * of sets of Loc objects. The reason"
" * this change is being done is because"
" * the game needs to know which way the"
" * piece is generating the move so that"
" * it can determine whether the piece"
" * has a presence on a space or not,"
" * collides with a piece of the same color"
"! Keeps track of the number of pieces, of a certain type,"
" that have the move specified by the user."
"! pt: piece type, corresponds to the int value of an enum name in PieceType"
"! pcolor: the color of the opposing person"
"! piece: the other set of pieces"
"! pt: piece type, corresponds to the int value of an enum name in PieceType"
"! pt: piece type, corresponds to the int value of an enum name in PieceType"
"! Indicates which player's are targeting the space, indexed by the Color enum"
" Need triple pointer so that const color of the space can be set correctly, and not be set to BLANK."
" Number of players that can play game"
" Number of pieces that a player has"
" The number of unique piece types"
" [] : piece set for a certain color, index by the Color enum"
" [][] : set of start locations for a certain piece type, index by the PieceType enum"
" [][][] : The location of a piece, index by how many pieces of a certain type you have already placed"
" * Piece[i] : pointer, pointer that represents the piece type which is indexed by the PieceType enum"
" * Piece[i][j] : pointer that represents the pointer to the piece"
" * A pointer is needed to the piece so that const values can be constructed correctly."
" * This is the source code group."
" * \brief The code that debugs the program"
" * Comments: This code uses Doxygen styled comments."
" * Copyright Â©2011-2012 Benjamin Kellogg all rights are reserved."
"! Defines whether the program should be debugged or not"
" * Specifies that a class should not be"
" * Specifies that a class should be"
" * Specifies that a class member function"
" * Specifies that a class member function"
" Need triple pointer so that const color of the space can be set correctly, and not be set to BLANK."

" * from the piece, you will need"
" * to query the board to know if"
" * to have sets of Move objects instead"
" * of sets of Loc objects. The reason"
" * this change is being done is because"
" * the game needs to know which way the"
" * piece is generating the move so that"
" * it can determine whether the piece"
" * has a presence on a space or not,"
" * collides with a piece of the same color"
"! Keeps track of the number of pieces, of a certain type,"
" that have the move specified by the user."
"! pt: piece type, corresponds to the int value of an enum name in PieceType"
"! pcolor: the color of the opposing person"
"! piece: the other set of pieces"
"! pt: piece type, corresponds to the int value of an enum name in PieceType"
"! pt: piece type, corresponds to the int value of an enum name in PieceType"

" Number of pieces that a player has"

" [][] : set of start locations for a certain piece type, index by the PieceType enum"
" [][][] : The location of a piece, index by how many pieces of a certain type you have already placed"
